result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek A Cummings was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with any juvenile females unless in the presence of a parent or guardian. Must not possess any computer or device with Internet access. May not access the Internet unless approved by the probation agent. May not possess any pornography of any kind. 

06/09/2021 AMENDED: COURT REMOVES THE CONDITION " MUST NOT POSSESS ANY COMPUTER OR DEVICE WITH INTERNET ACCESS".
Must register as a sex offender. Must undergo a child sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended follow-up. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Court grants work release. Must report to jail today, 10/9/2015 by 4:30 PM.

records.addlTxt:
02:02 PM Defendant Derek A Cummings in court by zoom audio.  John O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation agent in court by zoom audio. 
Request to delete a condition of probation.  Court grants the request and removes the condition that he must not possess any computer or device with internet access. All other conditions remain in full force and effect.
Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
from Attorney Schembera  - No longer represents the Defendant.
Petition and stipulation to amend judgment of conviction in probation cases.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief
Defense's Alternative and attached Psychosexual Evaluation.

Defendant Derek A Cummings in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSIs discussed. Corrections noted by Defense. State makes recommendation. Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court. 

Court relates and orders: 
10 Year Prison - STAYED 
3 Years 0 Months Initial Confinement 
7 Years 0 Months Extended Supervision. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.

10 Years Probation - IMPOSED
1 year jail with work release to begin today. Must report to jail today, 10/9/15 by 4:30 PM. 
Must register as a sex offender. 
Must undergo a child sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended follow-up. 
Must have no contact with any juvenile females unless in the presence of a parent or guardian. 
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Must not possess any computer or device with Internet access. 
May not access the Internet unless approved by the probation agent. 
May not possess any pornography of any kind. 
Court costs including a $2500.00 surcharge 

WEDS form given. Voters rights given. Felony admonitions given.

Defendant Derek M Cummings not in court.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Middle Initial should be   A.       Court amends the middle inital to A         

  a   PSI needs to be amended.

Defendant Derek M Cummings in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Court accepts Defendant's plea and finds Defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court orders PSI. Counts 2 - 5 are DRI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek M Cummings in court with attorney William A. Schembera.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives a preliminary hearing. Court accepts the waiver. Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
State files information. 
  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not use any computer or access the Internet. 
Must not possess pornography. 
Must not have contact with any minor children unless supervised by a parent or guardian.

Defendant Derek M Cummings in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde (for today).  Defendant Derek M Cummings in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
